description.zh-cn: 宋朝第三位皇帝，宋太宗第三子，在位25年。其统治前期，社会经济繁荣，史称“咸平之治”；后期则热衷于封禅和天书等道教活动。
description.en: The third emperor of the Song Dynasty, the third son of Emperor Taizong, who reigned for 25 years. The early part of his reign was a period of prosperity known as the 'Reign of Xianping', while the later part was marked by his devotion to Daoist activities such as the Feng and Shan sacrifices and the 'Heavenly Books'.

description.zh-cn: 宋朝第二位皇帝，宋真宗之父。
description.en: The second emperor of the Song Dynasty, father of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 宋太宗的妾室，宋真宗和楚王赵元佐的生母。
description.en: A concubine of Emperor Taizong and the biological mother of Emperor Zhenzong and Prince Zhao Yuanzuo.

description.zh-cn: 宋太宗长子，宋真宗长兄。曾被宋太宗属意为太子，后因精神失常被废。
description.en: The eldest son of Emperor Taizong and elder brother of Emperor Zhenzong. He was once considered the heir apparent by Emperor Taizong but was later deposed due to mental illness.

description.zh-cn: 宋朝第四位皇帝，宋真宗第六子，由章献明肃皇后和章惠皇后抚养长大。
description.en: The fourth emperor of the Song Dynasty, the sixth son of Emperor Zhenzong, raised by Empress Zhangxian Mingsu and Empress Zhanghui.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宦官，在宋太宗驾崩时意图联合李昌龄、胡旦废黜太子赵恒，改立赵元佐为帝。
description.en: A Northern Song eunuch who, upon Emperor Taizong's death, attempted to conspire with Li Changling and Hu Dan to depose Crown Prince Zhao Heng and install Zhao Yuanzuo as emperor.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相。在宋太宗驾崩后，他识破并挫败了王继恩等人废立太子的阴谋，确保了宋真宗的顺利继位。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song. After Emperor Taizong's death, he saw through and foiled the plot by Wang Ji'en and others to depose the crown prince, ensuring Emperor Zhenzong's smooth succession.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的一个朝代，分为北宋和南宋两个阶段。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history, divided into the Northern Song and Southern Song periods.

description.zh-cn: 由契丹族建立的统治中国北方的王朝，与北宋长期对峙。
description.en: A dynasty established by the Khitan people that ruled northern China and was a long-term rival of the Northern Song.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相。在辽国入侵时，他力主抵抗，并促成宋真宗御驾亲征，最终达成澶渊之盟。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song. When the Liao state invaded, he strongly advocated for resistance and persuaded Emperor Zhenzong to lead the army personally, which ultimately led to the Treaty of Chanyuan.

description.zh-cn: 北宋与辽朝于景德元年（1004年）在澶州签订的和平条约。条约规定宋朝每年向辽支付岁币，换取和平，开启了两国百余年的和平与贸易。
description.en: A peace treaty signed between the Northern Song and the Liao dynasty in Chanzhou in 1004 (the first year of the Jingde era). The treaty stipulated that the Song would pay an annual tribute to the Liao in exchange for peace, inaugurating over a century of peace and trade between the two states.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗统治前期，因其勤于政事，国家经济繁荣，社会稳定，史称“咸平之治”。
description.en: During the early reign of Emperor Zhenzong, due to his diligent administration, the country experienced economic prosperity and social stability, a period known in history as the 'Reign of Xianping'.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相。在宋真宗统治后期，他迎合皇帝，积极参与和推动了“天书封祀”等政治事件。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song. During the late reign of Emperor Zhenzong, he catered to the emperor's wishes and actively participated in and promoted political events such as the 'Heavenly Book and Feng Shan Sacrifices'.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相。与王钦若一同在宋真宗后期倡导道教和“天书封祀”，并负责修建玉清昭应宫。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song. Along with Wang Qinruo, he advocated for Daoism and the 'Heavenly Book and Feng Shan Sacrifices' during the late reign of Emperor Zhenzong and was responsible for the construction of the Yuqing Zhaoying Palace.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗统治后期，由王钦若、丁谓等人主导，制造天降祥瑞“天书”，并据此举行封泰山、祀汾阳等大规模祭祀活动，耗费巨大。
description.en: A major political event during the late reign of Emperor Zhenzong, led by figures like Wang Qinruo and Ding Wei. It involved fabricating auspicious 'Heavenly Books' from the sky and conducting large-scale, costly sacrifices, including the Feng and Shan ceremonies at Mount Tai and Fenyang.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗的皇后，宋仁宗的养母。在仁宗即位后成为宋朝第一位临朝称制的皇太后。
description.en: Empress of Emperor Zhenzong and adoptive mother of Emperor Renzong. She became the first empress dowager to rule as regent in the Song Dynasty after Emperor Renzong's accession.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗的妃嫔，原为章献明肃皇后的侍女，宋仁宗的生母。
description.en: A concubine of Emperor Zhenzong, originally a handmaiden to Empress Zhangxian Mingsu, and the biological mother of Emperor Renzong.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗的继妻，被册封为皇后，生下悼献太子赵玄祐。
description.en: The second wife of Emperor Zhenzong, who was made empress and gave birth to the Crown Prince Daoxian, Zhao You.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗第二子，母章穆皇后郭氏，十岁时夭折。
description.en: The second son of Emperor Zhenzong, his mother was Empress Zhangmu (née Guo). He died prematurely at the age of ten.

description.zh-cn: 北宋外交官。作为宋方使节前往辽营谈判，最终签订了澶渊之盟。
description.en: A diplomat of the Northern Song. He served as the Song envoy to the Liao camp for negotiations, which resulted in the signing of the Treaty of Chanyuan.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相。他在临终时对自己未能劝谏宋真宗停止“天书”事件而深感懊悔。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song. On his deathbed, he deeply regretted his failure to persuade Emperor Zhenzong to stop the 'Heavenly Book' affair.

description.zh-cn: 北宋的京畿行政区，府尹一职常由亲王或储君担任，地位显赫。
description.en: The capital prefecture of the Northern Song Dynasty. The position of its governor (Yin) was often held by princes or the crown prince, indicating its high status.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗是宋太宗的第三个儿子。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong was the third son of Emperor Taizong.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗的生母是元德皇后李氏。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong's biological mother was Empress Yuande (née Li).

description.zh-cn: 宋仁宗是宋真宗的第六个儿子。
description.en: Emperor Renzong was the sixth son of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 宋仁宗的生母是章懿皇后李氏。
description.en: Emperor Renzong's biological mother was Empress Zhangyi (née Li).

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗与楚王赵元佐是同母兄弟，赵元佐是其长兄。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong and Prince Zhao Yuanzuo of Chu were full brothers; Zhao Yuanzuo was his elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗作为宋朝的第三位皇帝，在位共25年。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong reigned as the third emperor of the Song Dynasty for 25 years.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗在登基前曾担任开封府尹。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong served as the Prefect of Kaifeng before his accession to the throne.

description.zh-cn: 在宋太宗驾崩之际，王继恩意图发动政变，废黜当时的太子赵恒（即后来的宋真宗）。
description.en: Upon the death of Emperor Taizong, Wang Ji'en attempted a coup to depose the then Crown Prince Zhao Heng (later Emperor Zhenzong).

description.zh-cn: 吕端及时识破并挫败了王继恩的政变阴谋，确保了太子赵恒顺利继承皇位。
description.en: Lü Duan promptly saw through and thwarted Wang Ji'en's coup plot, ensuring that Crown Prince Zhao Heng ascended the throne smoothly.

description.zh-cn: 景德元年（1004年），辽朝大举入侵宋朝，兵锋直指澶州。
description.en: In the first year of the Jingde era (1004), the Liao dynasty launched a major invasion of the Song dynasty, with their forces advancing directly on Chanzhou.

description.zh-cn: 寇准是宋真宗时期的宰相。
description.en: Kou Zhun was a prime minister during the reign of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 面对辽国入侵，寇准极力主张抵抗，并说服宋真宗御驾亲征以鼓舞士气。
description.en: Facing the Liao invasion, Kou Zhun strongly advocated for resistance and persuaded Emperor Zhenzong to personally lead the expedition to boost morale.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗御驾亲征至澶州，与辽国对峙后，最终决定派使臣谈判，促成了澶渊之盟的签订。
description.en: Emperor Zhenzong personally led his army to Chanzhou, and after a standoff with the Liao forces, he decided to send an envoy for negotiations, which led to the signing of the Treaty of Chanyuan.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗统治前期勤于政事，其政策促进了农业和手工业的发展，开创了“咸平之治”的繁荣局面。
description.en: In his early reign, Emperor Zhenzong was diligent in state affairs, and his policies promoted the development of agriculture and handicrafts, creating the prosperous situation of the 'Reign of Xianping'.

description.zh-cn: 王钦若是宋真宗统治后期的宰相。
description.en: Wang Qinruo was a prime minister during the late reign of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 丁谓是宋真宗统治后期的宰相。
description.en: Ding Wei was a prime minister during the late reign of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 王钦若迎合宋真宗，导演了天降“天书”的事件，并积极推动后续的封禅大典。
description.en: Wang Qinruo catered to Emperor Zhenzong by orchestrating the event of the 'Heavenly Book' descending from the sky and actively promoted the subsequent Feng and Shan grand ceremonies.

description.zh-cn: 丁谓与王钦若一同支持并参与了“天书封祀”活动，以此巩固自己的政治地位。
description.en: Ding Wei, along with Wang Qinruo, supported and participated in the 'Heavenly Book and Feng Shan Sacrifices' to consolidate his political position.

description.zh-cn: 宋真宗统治后期信奉道教，亲自导演并推动了“天书”降临和封禅泰山等一系列政治活动。
description.en: In his later reign, Emperor Zhenzong became a devout follower of Daoism, personally directing and promoting a series of political activities including the descent of the 'Heavenly Book' and the Feng and Shan sacrifices at Mount Tai.

description.zh-cn: 宋仁宗即位后，将宋真宗遗留的“天书”随之殉葬，表明了对这一系列事件的否定态度。
description.en: After ascending the throne, Emperor Renzong had the 'Heavenly Book' left by Emperor Zhenzong buried with him, indicating his disapproval of the affair.

description.zh-cn: 章献明肃皇后刘氏是宋真宗的第三位皇后。
description.en: Empress Zhangxian Mingsu (née Liu) was the third empress of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 章穆皇后郭氏是宋真宗的第二位皇后。
description.en: Empress Zhangmu (née Guo) was the second empress of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 章懿李皇后是宋真宗的妃嫔，宋仁宗的生母。
description.en: Empress Zhangyi (née Li) was a consort of Emperor Zhenzong and the biological mother of Emperor Renzong.

description.zh-cn: 章献明肃皇后没有生育，抚养了宋仁宗赵祯。
description.en: Empress Zhangxian Mingsu was childless and raised Emperor Renzong, Zhao Zhen.

description.zh-cn: 赵玄祐是宋真宗的第二子。
description.en: Zhao You was the second son of Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 赵玄祐的生母是章穆皇后郭氏。
description.en: Zhao You's biological mother was Empress Zhangmu (née Guo).

description.zh-cn: 曹利用是宋真宗派遣的谈判使臣。
description.en: Cao Liyong was the negotiating envoy sent by Emperor Zhenzong.

description.zh-cn: 在曹利用出使前，寇准警告他，如果岁币超过三十万，就会将他处斩，以此施压其尽力谈判。
description.en: Before Cao Liyong's diplomatic mission, Kou Zhun warned him that if the annual tribute exceeded 300,000, he would be executed, thereby pressuring him to negotiate to the best of his ability.
